Class ec.ifc.app.ECTabItem 

java.lang.Object
   |
   +----ec.ifc.app.ECTabItem
public class ECTabItem
extends Object
implements Cloneable
Class representing one tab in an ECTabView.
See Also:
ECTabView

ECTabItem()
Returns a new ECTabItem with background color light gray and selected color white.

clone()
Clones the ECTabItem.
drawBackground(Graphics, Rect)
Called from drawInRect() to draw the ECTabItem's background (everything other than the title).
drawInRect(Graphics, Rect, boolean)
Called by ECTabView to draw the tab.
drawStringInRect(Graphics, String, Font, Color, Rect, boolean)
Called from drawInRect() to draw the ECTabItem's title.
getBackgroundColor()
Returns the color the ECTabItem uses to draw its background when not selected.
getCommand()
Returns the command associated with this ECTabItem.
getFont()
Returns the Font the ECTabItem uses to render its title.
getSelectedColor()
Returns the color the ECTabItem uses to draw its background when selected.

Returns the ECTabView associated with the ECTabItem.
getTitle()
Returns the title the ECTabItem displays.
getTitleColor()
Returns the color the ECTabItem uses to draw its title.
isHilited()
Returns true if the ECTabItem is selected.
isSelected()
Returns true if the ECTabItem is selected.
setBackgroundColor(Color)
Sets the color the ECTabItem uses to draw its background when not selected.

Sets the command associated with this ECTabItem.
setFont(Font)
Sets the font the ECTabItem uses to draw its title.
setHilited(boolean)
Called by ECTabView when a ECTabItem is going to be subjected to drop.
setSelected(boolean)
Called by ECTabView when a ECTabItem is selected.
setSelectedColor(Color)
Sets the color the ECTabItem uses to draw its background when selected.
setTitle(String)
Sets the title the ECTabItem displays.
setTitleColor(Color)
Sets the color the ECTabItem uses to draw its background when not selected.

ECTabItem 
  public ECTabItem()
Returns a new ECTabItem with background color light gray and selected color white.

clone 
  public Object clone()
Clones the ECTabItem. ECTabView adds additional tabs by cloning its prototype ECTabItem.
Overrides:
clone in class Object
drawInRect 
  public void drawInRect(Graphics g,
                         Rect boundsRect,
                         boolean toDrawString)
Called by ECTabView to draw the tab. The horizontal space between tabs has already been taken into account, so the tab should extend to all edges of boundsRect. This just calls drawBackground() and drawStringInRect() in turn, so subclasses might want to override one or the other of those methods rather than this one.
getBackgroundColor 
  public Color getBackgroundColor()
Returns the color the ECTabItem uses to draw its background when not selected. By default this is Color.lightGray
getCommand 
  public String getCommand()
Returns the command associated with this ECTabItem.
See Also:
setCommand
getFont 
  public Font getFont()
Returns the Font the ECTabItem uses to render its title. If no font has been set, returns Font.defaultFont().
getTabView 
  public ECTabView getTabView()
Returns the ECTabView associated with the ECTabItem. Returns null if the ECTabItem is not in an ECTabView.
getSelectedColor 
  public Color getSelectedColor()
Returns the color the ECTabItem uses to draw its background when selected. By default this is Color.white
getTitle 
  public String getTitle()
Returns the title the ECTabItem displays.
See Also:
setTitle
getTitleColor 
  public Color getTitleColor()
Returns the color the ECTabItem uses to draw its title. By default this is Color.black.
isHilited 
  public boolean isHilited()
Returns true if the ECTabItem is selected.
See Also:
setSelected
isSelected 
  public boolean isSelected()
Returns true if the ECTabItem is selected.
See Also:
setSelected
setBackgroundColor 
  public void setBackgroundColor(Color newBackgroundColor)
Sets the color the ECTabItem uses to draw its background when not selected.
See Also:
getBackgroundColor
setCommand 
  public void setCommand(String newCommand)
Sets the command associated with this ECTabItem. ECTabView sends ECTabItem's command when the ECTabItem is clicked.
setFont 
  public void setFont(Font newFont)
Sets the font the ECTabItem uses to draw its title.
setHilited 
  public void setHilited(boolean flag)
Called by ECTabView when a ECTabItem is going to be subjected to drop.
setSelected 
  public void setSelected(boolean flag)
Called by ECTabView when a ECTabItem is selected. By default, selected ECTabItems highlight by painting a white background.
setSelectedColor 
  public void setSelectedColor(Color newSelectedColor)
Sets the color the ECTabItem uses to draw its background when selected.
See Also:
getSelectedColor
setTitle 
  public void setTitle(String newTitle)
Sets the title the ECTabItem displays.
setTitleColor 
  public void setTitleColor(Color newTitleColor)
Sets the color the ECTabItem uses to draw its background when not selected.
See Also:
getBackgroundColor
drawBackground 
  protected void drawBackground(Graphics g,
                                Rect boundsRect)
Called from drawInRect() to draw the ECTabItem's background (everything other than the title). Subclasses can override this method to draw the background in a special way.
drawStringInRect 
  protected void drawStringInRect(Graphics g,
                                  String title,
                                  Font titleFont,
                                  Color titleColor,
                                  Rect textBounds,
                                  boolean horizontal)
Called from drawInRect() to draw the ECTabItem's title. Subclasses can override this method to draw the title string in a special way.
